thread.title: Sentence handed to man who had sex with 13-year-old runaway
thread.title_full: Sentence handed to man who had sex with 13-year-old runaway

author: Aileen Wingblad
title: Sentence handed to man who had sex with 13-year-old runaway
text:
News Crime and Public Safety SUBSCRIBER ONLY Crime and Public Safety | Sentence handed to man who had sex with 13-year-old runaway Share this: Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Click to share on Twitter (Opens in new window) Click to print (Opens in new window) Aileen Wingblad/MediaNews Group Judge Martha Anderson file photo (Aileen Wingblad/MediaNews Group) By Aileen Wingblad | awingblad@medianewsgroup.com | The Oakland Press UPDATED: August 15, 2024 at 4:52 p.m. A White Lake Township man was sentenced to prison Thursday for having sex with a 13-year-old runaway from Waterford Township.
At a hearing in Oakland County Circuit Court, Judge Martha Anderson told Douglas Marcel Corbeau that he will spend two to 15 years in prison for third-degree criminal sexual conduct for the incident that happened last January.
Oakland County Jail Douglas Corbeau Corbeau, 21, pleaded guilty June 13 to the felony, along with a misdemeanor charge of harboring a runaway. For the misdemeanor, he was sentenced to five days in jail but had jail credit of five days so that has already been satisfied.
In exchange for his plea, prosecutors dismissed two other charges of third-degree criminal sexual conduct against Corbeau.
Related Articles Crime and Public Safety | Life-saving crews dispatched late to Oxford school shooting, fire chiefs say Crime and Public Safety | Sheriff’s office quashed review of emergency response to Oxford school shooting Crime and Public Safety | State officials say pool of crime victims, compensation received have risen Crime and Public Safety | Authorities: Dispatchers hear man tell girlfriend ‘game over’ before he fatally shot her Crime and Public Safety | Commerce Township man set for court after March explosion in Clinton Township The Oakland Press typically doesn’t name alleged victims of criminal sexual assault, or minors purported to be victims or perpetrators of crimes.
Corbeau spent a few days in the Oakland County Jail after he was arrested on Jan. 16. He was released after posting 10 percent of a $25,000 bond. He was back in jail Thursday afternoon following his sentencing hearing.
